    The Origins of the Opioid Crisis with Leo Beletsky

    28 Nov 2017

    The drug war is a cause of, not solution to, the overdose crisis. Law and public health scholar @LeoBeletsky explains the origins of the opioid overdose crisis and how drug prohibition, policing, interdiction and incarceration are at its root—and continue to help make opioid use so deadly. Thanks to our supporters at Verso Books. Check out Out of the Wreckage: A New Politics for an Age of Crisis by George Monbiot Support us with your $ at Patreon.com/TheDig We can’t do this without our listeners.

    Topics: Criminal Justice Healthcare Drugs Police Prison Reform US Politics
    Guests: Leo Beletsky
